rules: Rule1: If the lab confirms an outbreak in the region, then the surveillance system detects an outbreak in the region.
Rule2: Either the surveillance system issues a false alarm for the region, or the lab confirms an outbreak in the region.
Rule3: Whenever the medical team uses a ventilator as a tool, they use an ambulance as a vehicle.
Rule4: Either the government implements a lockdown in the city, or the government implements a quarantine in the city.

Rule5: Should the government implement a quarantine in the city, then if it is not the case that the absence of the virus spreading leads to the research team having a vaccine, the government contains an outbreak in the region.

Rule6: Either the government deploys the medical team, or if the government implements a lockdown in the city, then the absence of the virus spreading implying the research team has a vaccine results in the government containing an outbreak in the region.
Rule7: If the surveillance system detects an outbreak in the region, then the absence of the virus spreading implies that the research team has a vaccine for the virus.
Rule8: Whenever it is false that the research team having a treatment leads to them having a vaccine, the medical team uses a ventilator as a tool.
Rule9: Provided that it is not true that the research team having a treatment results in them having a vaccine, the medical team does not use an ambulance as a vehicle.
Rule10: In the absence of the virus spreading, the research team has a treatment for the virus.
Rule11: Should the virus not be spreading, then it is not the case that the research team has a vaccine for the virus.
facts: Fact1: It is not the case that the surveillance system issues a false alarm for the region.
Fact2: The government does not contain an outbreak in the region.
Fact3: It is false that the government deploys the medical team.

question: The virus spreading is a natural phenomenon.
